content: mount ambler by gabriella roberts details sizing 1 2 3 4 baby toddler small adult large adult blue sky fibers woolstock malabrigo rios yarn this pattern is suitable for any worsted weight yarn you could also hold a dk + mohair togther to get a beautiful halo effect woolstock is a beautiful fluffy 100% fine highland wool yarn that comes in 50g balls of 123yds each malabrigo is a kettle dyed 100% superwash merino that comes in a 220yds/100g skein gauge 16 sts to 30 row for 4 working in established pattern needles us 6-16 us 8-16 stitch markers notions measuring tape darning needle abbreviations co cast-on p purl st s stitche s bor beginning of the round rs right side m stitch marker k knit pm place marker sm slip marker ktbl knit though the back loop i d love to see your in-progress pictures and finished object photographs please feel free to tag me on instagram @knittygritty and use the hashtag #mountamblerhat mount ambler my ravelry group is one more row woodstock and more information about my classes & weekly knit nights can be found on my website www onemorerow net for any pattern questions or support please email me at gabby@onemorerow net 2 using smaller needles cast on 48 68 80 88 sts and join in the round pm work in a ktbl p1 rib for 1 5 in/3 75 cm on the first round of the pattern change to larger needle size pattern 1-2 knit 3 p1 k3 around 4-5 knit 6 k2 p1 k3 to last 2 sts p1 k1 repeat rounds until hat measures 3 5 6 5 7 inches from brim ending after a knit round during decreases switch to dpn or magic loop as necessary size 2 k15 k2tog around 64 sts decreases 1 k6 k2tog around 2 & all even rounds knit 3 k5 k2tog around 5 k4 k2tog around 7 k3 k2tog around 9 k2 k2tog around 11 k1 k2tog around 12 k2tog around finishing cut yarn leaving a 6 in/15cm tail using a darning needle run yarn clockwise through live stitches slide off the needle & pull tightly weave in ends
